law.catch_line: Peace officers to prevent unauthorized shows or exhibitions.
law.text: All peace officers, who are informed or who have reason to believe that a show or exhibition that is in violation of this chapter or administrative regulations promulgated in accordance with this chapter is about to take place, or that there is training or preparation for such a show or exhibition, in any place within their jurisdiction, shall suppress and prevent it. For this purpose any peace officer may enter any place where such show or exhibition is being or will be held or where there is training or preparation for such a show or exhibition and may arrest without a warrant any person who does not submit satisfactory proof that he or she has the license or permit required by this chapter.
law.history: Amended 2008 Ky. Acts ch. 91, sec. 21, effective July 15, 2008. -- Amended 2000 Ky. Acts ch. 106, sec. 5, effective July 14, 2000. -- Created 1964 Ky. Acts ch. 170, sec. 22.
